page.title: 02TRAVEL
page.content: The 2 most important roads in the block are the{A48,}which now by-passes Cowbridge and the {B4270 }linking Cowbridge with Pontyclun. This road is especially busy on Tuesdays, market day in Cowbridge. There is little public transport, possibaly because the Vale is a relatively prosperous area and most families have at least one car.There are a few village bus routes but most buses run West-East along the{A48. The local railway was opened in 1865 and closed in 1951. The nearest B.R station is Bridgend. There is an international airport at Rhoose. The third year pupils at Cowbridge School who compiled this survey live in Cowbridge and the Vale. Most come to School by bus from outlying villages.{Thanks to C. Flower and {B.Palmer for computer work}
